content:
Synthesis. Warning! The reported azido complexes are potentially explosive. Only a small amount of material should be prepared, and it should be handled with care.

(a) [Cu 2 ( μ 1,1 -N 3 ) 2 (4-Etpy) 4 ( μ -NO 3 ) 2 ] (1). Copper(II) nitrate trihydrate (0.72 g, 3 mmol) and 4-ethylpyridine (0,75 g, 7 mmol) were mixed in 40 cm3 of acetone. An aqueous solution (5 cm3) of NaN3 (0.39 g, 6 mmol) was added to this mixture with continuous stirring. DMF was then added to dissolve any precipitate, and the final clear solution mixture was allowed to stand in a desiccator containing a beaker filled with diethyl ether until good quality crystals formed. Yield ca. 45% (with respect to copper). Anal. Calcd for C28H36Cu2N12O6:  C, 44.0; H, 4.8; N, 22.0; Cu, 16.6. Found:  C, 44.0; H, 4.6; N, 21.7; Cu, 16.3.

(b) [Cu 2 ( μ 1,1 -N 3 ) 2 (3-ampy) 4 ( μ -NO 3 ) 2 ]·C 2 H 5 OH (2). An ethanol solution of 3-aminopyridine (0.58 g, 8 mmol) was added to Cu(NO3)2·3H2O (0.72 g, 3 mmol) dissolved in ethanol (20 cm3). Upon dropwise addition of NaN3 (0.32 g, 5 mmol) dissolved in 5 cm3 of water, a precipitate was obtained. DMF was then added to the heterogeneous mixture until there was complete dissolution of the precipitate. The final solution mixture was filtered and allowed to stand in a refrigerator for ca. two months until small black crystals of the complex formed. Yield ca. 50% (with respect to copper). Anal. Calcd for C22H30Cu2N16O7:  C, 34.9; H, 4.0; N, 29.6; Cu, 16.8. Found:  C, 34.7; H, 3.9; N, 29.9; Cu, 16.7.

(c) [Cu 3 ( μ 1,1 -N 3 ) 4 (N 3 ) 2 (Meinic) 2 (DMF) 2 ] (3). Copper(II) nitrate trihydrate (0.72 g, 3 mmol) and methyl isonicotinate (1.10 g, 8 mmol) were mixed together in acetone (30 cm3) followed by dropwise addition of an aqueous solution (5 cm3) of NaN3 (0.39 g, 6 mmol) until an olive-green precipitate was formed. DMF was then added until the precipitate disssolved. The clear solution mixture was then boiled for about 15 min and allowed to stand in an open beaker for several weeks to deposit black, well-formed crystals of the complex. Yield:  20% (with respect to copper). Anal. Calcd for C20H28Cu3N22O6:  C, 27.8; H, 3.3; N, 35.7; Cu, 22.1. Found, C 27.6, H, 3.2; N, 35.5; Cu, 22.0.

Synthesis.  Warning! The reported azido complexes are potentially explosive. Only a small amount of material should be prepared, and it should be handled with care. 

 (a) [Cu  2  ( μ  1,1  -N  3  )  2  (4-Etpy)  4  ( μ -NO  3  )  2  ] (1). Copper(II) nitrate trihydrate (0.72 g, 3 mmol) and 4-ethylpyridine (0,75 g, 7 mmol) were mixed in 40 cm3 of acetone. An aqueous solution (5 cm3) of NaN3 (0.39 g, 6 mmol) was added to this mixture with continuous stirring. DMF was then added to dissolve any precipitate, and the final clear solution mixture was allowed to stand in a desiccator containing a beaker filled with diethyl ether until good quality crystals formed. Yield ca. 45% (with respect to copper). Anal. Calcd for C28H36Cu2N12O6: C, 44.0; H, 4.8; N, 22.0; Cu, 16.6. Found: C, 44.0; H, 4.6; N, 21.7; Cu, 16.3. 

 (b) [Cu  2  ( μ  1,1  -N  3  )  2  (3-ampy)  4  ( μ -NO  3  )  2  ]⋅C  2  H  5  OH (2). An ethanol solution of 3-aminopyridine (0.58 g, 8 mmol) was added to Cu(NO3)2⋅3H2O (0.72 g, 3 mmol) dissolved in ethanol (20 cm3). Upon dropwise addition of NaN3 (0.32 g, 5 mmol) dissolved in 5 cm3 of water, a precipitate was obtained. DMF was then added to the heterogeneous mixture until there was complete dissolution of the precipitate. The final solution mixture was filtered and allowed to stand in a refrigerator for ca. two months until small black crystals of the complex formed. Yield ca. 50% (with respect to copper). Anal. Calcd for C22H30Cu2N16O7: C, 34.9; H, 4.0; N, 29.6; Cu, 16.8. Found: C, 34.7; H, 3.9; N, 29.9; Cu, 16.7. 

 (c) [Cu  3  ( μ  1,1  -N  3  )  4  (N  3  )  2  (Meinic)  2  (DMF)  2  ] (3). Copper(II) nitrate trihydrate (0.72 g, 3 mmol) and methyl isonicotinate (1.10 g, 8 mmol) were mixed together in acetone (30 cm3) followed by dropwise addition of an aqueous solution (5 cm3) of NaN3 (0.39 g, 6 mmol) until an olive-green precipitate was formed. DMF was then added until the precipitate disssolved. The clear solution mixture was then boiled for about 15 min and allowed to stand in an open beaker for several weeks to deposit black, well-formed crystals of the complex. Yield: 20% (with respect to copper). Anal. Calcd for C20H28Cu3N22O6: C, 27.8; H, 3.3; N, 35.7; Cu, 22.1. Found, C 27.6, H, 3.2; N, 35.5; Cu, 22.0.
